page.title: 04Special Schools in Bletchley
page.content: The Oliver Wells school in Milton Keynes is for mentally and physically handicapped children.It was named after a man who,after losing both his legs in an accident built his own from metal and drove about on a motorbike with a sidecar. Paul and Joy from our school have been there because they have special needs.Joy went there after a road accident and it helped her to walk and talk again.Paul went there because he has a problem with his balance.There are physiotherapists there who helped him with exercises to strengthen his muscles. In my class there are about 32 children,but at Oliver Wells there are only 8_10 children in each class. The headmasters name is Trevor.The pupils at Oliver Wells try to make the best of life despite their handicaps.
